data.title: Algorius Net Viewer Manual | Main Window
data.text:
General Information

The main window contains the following components:

Menu

Tabs

Side bar

Editor

Status Bar

Some components of the main window can be hidden according to application settings.

To open the main window when it’s minimized in the system tray, click the tray icon or select Open Algorius Net Viewer from the icon's context menu:

If the main window opens on a second monitor that's turned off, for convenience, the context menu in the tray provides the Reset Window Position feature, which returns the window to the primary monitor.

Menu

Main in the main window contains the following items:

Главное меню

Welcome Page

Open Welcome Page in a tab.

See Welcome Page for more information. Show

Show or hide some components of the main window.

License Manager

Open the License Manager window.

See Registration for more information.

Options

Open a window to configure the Algorius Net Viewer. F9 Exit

Exit the software. Alt+X File Master

Open Network Discovery Wizard to create a new map.

See Network Discovery Wizard for more information. F6 Create

Create a new map.

See Creating Map for more information. Ctrl+N Open

Open a new map.

See Opening Map for more information. Ctrl+O

Recent

Select and open one of the recent opened maps.

See Opening Map for more information. Open Backup Folder

Open backup folder.

See Backup Copies for more information.

Save

Save the current map.

This option is available if there are any unsaved changes.

See Saving Map for more information. Ctrl+S Save As

Save the current map to a file.

See Saving Map for more information.

Save All

Save all modified maps.

This option is available if there are any unsaved changes.

See Saving Map for more information. Ctrl+Shift+S Save as Image

Save the map as an image file.

See Creating Screenshots for more information.

Make Screenshot

Copy the map image to the clipboard.

See Creating Screenshots for more information.

Export to Visio

Export current map into Visio document.

See Export for more information.

Print

Print a map.

See Printing Map for more information. Ctrl+P Close

Close a map.

This option is only available for maps opened locally.

See Closing Map for more information.

Close All

Close all maps opened locally.

See Closing Map for more information.

Edit Capture/Release Map

Capture the map for editing or fix changes on the map and finish its editing.

See Editing for more information. F2 Capture Map

Capture the map that is being edited by another user.

See Editing for more information. F2 Undo

Undo last changes.

See Editing History for more information. Ctrl+Z Redo

Redo last changes.

See Editing History for more information. Ctrl+Y Cut

Move selected objects to the clipboard.

See Clipboard for more information. Ctrl+X Copy

Copy selected objects to the clipboard.

See Clipboard for more information. Ctrl+C Paste

Paste objects from the clipboard.

See Clipboard for more information. Ctrl+V Delete

Delete selected objects.

See Deleting Map Objects for more information. Del Copy address

Copy addresses of the selected devices to the clipboard.

See Clipboard for more information. Ctrl+Shift+C Layout→Bring to Front

Move selected objects to front.

See Layout for more information. Ctrl+Home Layout→Send to Back

Move selected objects to back.

See Layout for more information. Ctrl+End Layout→Up

Move selected objects higher.

See Layout for more information. Ctrl+PgUp Layout→Down

Move selected objects lower.

See Layout for more information. Ctrl+PgDown

Layout→Auto Arrange

Arrange selected objects automatically.

See Layout for more information.

Lock

Lock selected object to prevent moving.

See Moving for more information.

Unlock

Unlock selected object for moving.

See Moving for more information.

Select All

Select all objects in the editor.

See Selecting Map Objects for more information. Ctrl+A Select Same Type

Select the same type objects on the map.

See Selecting Map Objects for more information. Ctrl+Shift+A Invert Selection

Deselect selected objects and select those that were not previously selected.

See Selecting Map Objects for more information. Ctrl+Shift+I Group operations

Change value of any attribute for devices on one or more maps.

See Group Operations for more information. Ctrl+G View Find

Search map objects by direct text query.

See Search for more information. Ctrl+F Advanced search

Search various objects by the values of their attributes

See Advanced Search for more information. Ctrl+Shift+F Mini-map

Show/Hide mini-map.

See Mini-map for more information. Space

Grid

Enable/Disable the grid display.

See Grid for more information. Full Screen

Switch on/off the full-screen mode.

See Full–Screen Mode for more information. F11 100%

Set scale to 100% for the current map.

See Scale for more information. Ctrl+0

Previous Tab

Go back to the previous tab.

See Navigation for more information. Alt+Left Next Tab

Go forward to the next tab.

See Navigation for more information. Alt+Right Theme

Selecting a color theme to display the application interface.

See Color Themes for more information.

Monitoring Refresh Map

Update status of devices on the map.

See Monitoring Control for more information. F5 Stop on Map

Pause monitoring of the current map.

Available if monitoring is not paused.

See Monitoring Control for more information.

Resume on Map

Resume monitoring of the current map.

Available if monitoring is paused.

See Monitoring Control for more information.

Clear Log

Clear monitoring log.

See Clear Monitoring Log for more information.

Notifications

Configure notification settings.

See Notification for more information. F3 Configure

Configure monitoring settings.

See Monitoring Configuration for more information. F8 Inventory Take Inventory

Open Taking Inventory window.

See Taking Inventory for more information.

Clear Log

Clear inventory log.

See Inventory Logs for more information.

Configure Sections

Configure inventory sections.

See Configuring Sections for more information.

Options

Configure inventory process.

See Configuring Inventory for more information.

Commands

This menu contains a list of external commands to execute.

See External Commands for more information.

Double-Click Actions

Configure double-click action for devices selected on the map.

See Double-Click Actions for more information.

Configure

Configure external commands.

See External Commands for more information. F7 Reports

This menu contains a list of reports for creation.

See Report Creation for more information.

Configure

Configure report templates.

See Configuring Reports for more information.

Tools Servers

Open Servers panel.

See Servers Panel for more information.

Maps

Open Maps panel.

See Maps Panel for more information. Ctrl+M Inventory Cards

Open Inventory Cards panel

See Inventory Cards for more information.

Reports

Open Reports panel.

See Reports Panel for more information.

Properties

Open Properties panel.

See Properties Panel for more information. F4 Layers

Open Layers panel.

See Layers for more information. Ctrl+L Devices

Open Devices panel.

See Devices Panel for more information. Ctrl+D Server Setup

Run Algorius Net Viewer Server Setup to configure the server.

See Server Installation for more information.

Help Help

View this help file. F1 What’s New

Read what’s new in the latest version of Algorius Net Viewer.

Check for Updates

Check for the newer version of Algorius Net Viewer.

See Update Algorius Net Viewer for more information. Customer Feedback

Send message for Algorius Net Viewer support team.

See Support for more information.

Visit Our Web Site

Open Algorius Net Viewer web site.

See Support for more information.

About

View information about the program.

Tabs

Tabs are displayed at the top of the main window and are used to switch between maps, inventory cards and welcome page quickly.

Tabs can be hidden. To show or hide tabs, select Show→Tabs from the main menu.

Toolbar

The toolbar is located at the top of the main window. The toolbar may be hidden. To show or hide the toolbar, select Show→Toolbar from the main menu.

Toolbar contains the following items:

Servers

Open Servers panel.

See Servers Panel for more information.

Maps

Open Maps panel.

See Maps Panel for more information. Ctrl+M Inventory Cards

Open Inventory Cards panel

See Inventory Cards for more information.

Reports

Open Reports panel.

See Reports Panel for more information.

Sidebar

Show/hide sidebar.

See Sidebar for more information.

In the map editor, the toolbar contains the following items:

Capture/Release Map

Capture the map for editing or fix changes on the map and finish its editing.

See Editing for more information. F2 Capture Map

Capture the map that is being edited by another user.

See Editing for more information. F2 Save

Save the current map.

This option is available if there are any unsaved changes.

See Saving Map for more information. Ctrl+S Save All

Save all modified maps.

This option is available if there are any unsaved changes.

See Saving Map for more information. Ctrl+Shift+S Undo

Undo last changes.

See Editing History for more information. Ctrl+Z Redo

Redo last changes.

See Editing History for more information. Ctrl+Y Scale

Set the scale for displaying objects on the map.

See Scale for more information.

Real size

Restore the scale to 100% for the current map.

See Scale for more information. Ctrl+0 Fit Page

Set the scale for the current map to show all objects on the map in the work area.

See Scale for more information.

Add device

Activate/deactivate adding device mode.

See Adding Devices for more information. D Add line

Activate/deactivate adding line mode.

See Adding Lines for more information. L Add figure

Activate/deactivate adding figure mode.

See Adding Figures for more information. F Add text

Activate/deactivate adding text field mode.

See Adding Text Field for more information. T Add image

Activate/deactivate adding graphic images mode.

See Adding Graphic Images for more information. I Add link to another map

Activate/deactivate adding map links mode.

See Adding Map Links for more information. M Add widget

Activate/deactivate adding widgets mode.

See Adding Widgets for more information. W Properties

Open Properties panel.

See Properties Panel for more information. F4 Layers

Open Layers panel.

See Layers for more information. Ctrl+L Devices

Open Devices panel.

See Devices Panel for more information. Ctrl+D

In the inventory card editor, the toolbar contains the following items:

Undo

Undo last changes.

See Editing History for more information. Ctrl+Z Redo

Redo last changes.

See Editing History for more information. Ctrl+Y Add Element

Add new element into the current inventory card.

See Card Editing for more information. Ins Edit Element

Edit selected element in the current inventory card.

See Card Editing for more information. Enter Show only filled sections

Switches the mode: display all sections or only completed ones.

See Card Editing for more information.

Sidebar

The main sidebar is shown on the left side of the main window.

The main sidebar displays the following tools:

Servers panel

Maps panel

Inventory cards panel

Reports panel

Additional sidebars appear on the right side of the editor.

The sidebar to the right of the map editor displays the following tools:

Properties panel

Layers panel

Devices panel

The sidebar to the right of the inventory card editor displays a list of sections.

The sidebar or some tools on it may be hidden. In this case they can be accessed through the Tools menu or using the corresponding buttons on the toolbar.

To show only one of the tools in the sidebar, left-click on the corresponding button in the toolbar.

To add or hide tools, click on the corresponding button on the toolbar with the right mouse button, or with the left mouse button while holding Ctrl or Shift. This method allows you to display several tools at once in the sidebar.

If several panels with tools are displayed on the sidebar, they can be adjusted in height by dragging the separator between them. Double-clicking the separator will make the height of these panels the same. Double-clicking the separator (while holding Ctrl or Shift) will make the height of all panels the same.

Editor

The editor takes the major part of the main window. It is designed to display and edit the maps and the inventory cards.

See Maps and Inventory Cards for more information.

Properties Panel

The Properties panel is located on the sidebar to the right of the map editor. It displays and edits map properties and properties of objects on the map.

The Properties panel may be hidden. To display the Properties panel, open a map and select Tools→Properties from the menu, or click the Properties button on the toolbar, or press F4.

Status Bar

The status bar is located at the bottom of the main window. The status bar can be hidden. To show or hide the status bar, select Show→Status Bar in the main menu.

The following information is displayed in the status bar:

The number of devices currently being scanned or that need to be scanned (i.e., in the queue). See Device Monitoring for more information.

Monitoring pause mode. See Device Monitoring for more information.

The number of devices, selected in the map editor. See Editing Maps for more information.

Number of devices on all maps. The total number of devices is shown separately, as well as the total number of active and inactive devices.

Number of current events according to notification settings. The number of alarms, errors, warnings and informational events is shown separately.

Number of messages, if any, according to notification settings. See Show message on the screen for more information.

The number of system errors that occurred in the application. If any error related to the application operation occurs, the corresponding indicator is displayed in the status bar. Clicking it opens a window with a more detailed error description.

The number of notifications, for example, about the release of a new version of the program or the license expiring. The corresponding indicator is displayed in the status bar if there are notifications. Clicking it opens a window with a more detailed notification description. These notifications can be disabled in the program settings in the General tab.

System Tray Icon

Algorius Net Viewer has informative system tray icon:

The tray icon contains a context menu with frequently used operations. See Main Window for more information.

The tray icon can change its color. The color of the tray icon reflects the current severity level of the events according to the notification settings. See Configuring Events for more information.

Full–Screen Mode
